MSP_API_VERSION.notes: Used by configurators to check compatibility.
MSP_API_VERSION.description: Provides the MSP protocol version and the INAV API version.

MSP_FC_VARIANT.description: Identifies the flight controller firmware variant (e.g., INAV, Betaflight).

MSP_FC_VERSION.description: Provides the specific version number of the flight controller firmware.

payload.name: hardwareRevision
payload.desc: Hardware revision number. 0 if not detected (`USE_HARDWARE_REVISION_DETECTION`).

payload.name: osdSupport
payload.desc: OSD chip type: 0=None, 2=Onboard (`USE_OSD`). INAV does not support slave OSD (1).

payload.name: commCapabilities
payload.desc: Communication capabilities bitmask: Bit 0=VCP support (`USE_VCP`), Bit 1=SoftSerial support (`USE_SOFTSERIAL1`/`2`).

payload.name: targetNameLength
payload.desc: Length of the target name string that follows.

payload.name: targetName
payload.desc: Target name string (e.g., "MATEKF405"). Length given by previous field.

MSP_BOARD_INFO.description: Provides information about the specific hardware board and its capabilities.

MSP_BUILD_INFO.description: Provides build date, time, and Git revision of the firmware.

payload.name: headingHoldRateLimit
payload.desc: Max rate for heading hold P term (`pidProfile()->heading_hold_rate_limit`).

payload.name: headingHoldLpfFreq
payload.desc: Fixed LPF frequency for heading hold error (`HEADING_HOLD_ERROR_LPF_FREQ`).

MSP_INAV_PID.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_PID` for core PIDs and other specific messages for filter settings.
MSP_INAV_PID.description: Retrieves legacy INAV-specific PID controller related settings. Many fields are now obsolete or placeholders.

MSP_SET_INAV_PID.description: Sets legacy INAV-specific PID controller related settings.

payload.name: craftName
payload.desc: The craft name string (`systemConfig()->craftName`). Null termination is *not* explicitly sent, the length is determined by the payload size.

payload.name: craftName
payload.desc: The new craft name string. Automatically null-terminated by the FC.

payload.name: maxAutoClimbRate
payload.desc: Max climb rate in autonomous modes (uses `fw.max_auto_climb_rate` or `mc.max_auto_climb_rate` based on platform).

payload.name: maxManualSpeed
payload.desc: Max speed in manual modes with GPS aiding (`navConfig()->general.max_manual_speed`).

payload.name: maxManualClimbRate
payload.desc: Max climb rate in manual modes with GPS aiding (uses `fw.max_manual_climb_rate` or `mc.max_manual_climb_rate`).

payload.name: mcMaxBankAngle
payload.desc: Max bank angle for multirotor position hold (`navConfig()->mc.max_bank_angle`).

MSP_NAV_POSHOLD.description: Retrieves navigation position hold and general manual/auto flight parameters. Some parameters depend on the platform type (Multirotor vs Fixed Wing).

payload.name: maxAutoClimbRate
payload.desc: Sets `fw.max_auto_climb_rate` or `mc.max_auto_climb_rate` based on current platform type.

MSP_SET_NAV_POSHOLD.description: Sets navigation position hold and general manual/auto flight parameters.

payload.name: accCalibAxisFlags
payload.desc: Flags indicating which axes of the accelerometer have been calibrated (`accGetCalibrationAxisFlags()`).

payload.name: magZeroX
payload.desc: Magnetometer zero offset for X-axis (`compassConfig()->magZero.raw[X]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: magZeroY
payload.desc: Magnetometer zero offset for Y-axis (`compassConfig()->magZero.raw[Y]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: magZeroZ
payload.desc: Magnetometer zero offset for Z-axis (`compassConfig()->magZero.raw[Z]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: opflowScale
payload.desc: Optical flow scale factor (`opticalFlowConfig()->opflow_scale * 256`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

payload.name: magGainX
payload.desc: Magnetometer gain/scale for X-axis (`compassConfig()->magGain[X]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: magGainY
payload.desc: Magnetometer gain/scale for Y-axis (`compassConfig()->magGain[Y]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: magGainZ
payload.desc: Magnetometer gain/scale for Z-axis (`compassConfig()->magGain[Z]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

MSP_CALIBRATION_DATA.notes: Total size 27 bytes. Fields related to optional sensors are zero if the sensor is not used.
MSP_CALIBRATION_DATA.description: Retrieves sensor calibration data (Accelerometer zero/gain, Magnetometer zero/gain, Optical Flow scale).

MSP_SET_CALIBRATION_DATA.notes: Expects 26 bytes. Ignores values for sensors not enabled by `USE_*` defines.

payload.name: minSats
payload.desc: Minimum satellites required for GPS use (`gpsConfigMutable()->gpsMinSats`).

payload.name: useGPSVelNED
payload.desc: Legacy flag, always 1 (GPS velocity is always used if available).

MSP_POSITION_ESTIMATION_CONFIG.description: Retrieves parameters related to the INAV position estimation fusion weights and GPS minimum satellite count.

MSP_SET_POSITION_ESTIMATION_CONFIG.description: Sets parameters related to the INAV position estimation fusion weights and GPS minimum satellite count.

payload.name: missionID
payload.desc: Reserved for future use, currently ignored.

MSP_WP_MISSION_LOAD.notes: Only functional if `NAV_NON_VOLATILE_WAYPOINT_STORAGE` is defined. Requires 1 byte payload. Returns error if loading fails.
MSP_WP_MISSION_LOAD.description: Commands the FC to load the waypoint mission stored in non-volatile memory (e.g., EEPROM or FlashFS) into the active mission buffer.

payload.name: missionID
payload.desc: Reserved for future use, currently ignored.

MSP_WP_MISSION_SAVE.notes: Only functional if `NAV_NON_VOLATILE_WAYPOINT_STORAGE` is defined. Requires 1 byte payload. Returns error if saving fails.
MSP_WP_MISSION_SAVE.description: Commands the FC to save the currently active waypoint mission from RAM to non-volatile memory (e.g., EEPROM or FlashFS).

payload.name: wpCapabilities
payload.desc: Reserved for future waypoint capabilities flags. Currently always 0.

payload.name: missionValid
payload.desc: Boolean flag indicating if the current mission in RAM is valid (`isWaypointListValid()`).

payload.name: waypointCount
payload.desc: Number of waypoints currently defined in the mission (`getWaypointCount()`).

MSP_WP_GETINFO.description: Retrieves information about the waypoint mission capabilities and the status of the currently loaded mission.

payload.name: minRthDistance
payload.desc: Minimum distance from home required for RTH to engage (`navConfig()->general.min_rth_distance`).

payload.name: rthClimbFirst
payload.desc: Flag: Climb to RTH altitude before returning (`navConfig()->general.flags.rth_climb_first`).

payload.name: rthClimbIgnoreEmerg
payload.desc: Flag: Climb even in emergency RTH (`navConfig()->general.flags.rth_climb_ignore_emerg`).

payload.name: rthAllowLanding
payload.desc: Flag: Allow automatic landing after RTH (`navConfig()->general.flags.rth_allow_landing`).

payload.name: rthAbortThreshold
payload.desc: Stick input threshold to abort RTH (`navConfig()->general.rth_abort_threshold`).

payload.name: landMinAltVspd
payload.desc: Landing vertical speed at minimum slowdown altitude (`navConfig()->general.land_minalt_vspd`).

payload.name: landMaxAltVspd
payload.desc: Landing vertical speed at maximum slowdown altitude (`navConfig()->general.land_maxalt_vspd`).

payload.name: emergDescentRate
payload.desc: Vertical speed during emergency landing descent (`navConfig()->general.emerg_descent_rate`).

MSP_RTH_AND_LAND_CONFIG.description: Retrieves configuration parameters related to Return-to-Home (RTH) and automatic landing behaviors.

MSP_SET_RTH_AND_LAND_CONFIG.description: Sets configuration parameters related to Return-to-Home (RTH) and automatic landing behaviors.

payload.name: maxDiveAngle
payload.desc: Maximum negative pitch angle during descent (`navConfig()->fw.max_dive_angle`).

MSP_FW_CONFIG.description: Retrieves configuration parameters specific to Fixed Wing navigation.

MSP_SET_FW_CONFIG.description: Sets configuration parameters specific to Fixed Wing navigation.

payload.name: modePermanentId
payload.desc: Permanent ID of the flight mode (maps to `boxId` via `findBoxByActiveBoxId`). 0 if entry unused.

payload.name: auxChannelIndex
payload.desc: 0-based index of the AUX channel used for activation.

payload.name: rangeStartStep
payload.desc: Start step (corresponding to channel value range 900-2100 in steps of 50/25, depends on steps calculation).

payload.name: rangeEndStep
payload.desc: End step for the activation range.

MSP_MODE_RANGES.notes: The number of steps and mapping to PWM values depends on internal range calculations.
MSP_MODE_RANGES.description: Returns all defined mode activation ranges (aux channel assignments for flight modes).

payload.name: rangeIndex
payload.desc: Index of the mode range to set (0 to `MAX_MODE_ACTIVATION_CONDITION_COUNT - 1`).

payload.name: modePermanentId
payload.desc: Permanent ID of the flight mode to assign.

MSP_SET_MODE_RANGE.notes: Expects 5 bytes. Updates the mode configuration and recalculates used mode flags. Returns error if `rangeIndex` or `modePermanentId` is invalid.
MSP_SET_MODE_RANGE.description: Sets a single mode activation range by its index.

MSP_FEATURE.description: Returns a bitmask of enabled features.

MSP_SET_FEATURE.notes: Expects 4 bytes. Updates feature configuration and related settings (e.g., RSSI source).
MSP_SET_FEATURE.description: Sets the enabled features using a bitmask. Clears all previous features first.

MSP_BOARD_ALIGNMENT.description: Returns the sensor board alignment angles relative to the craft frame.

MSP_SET_BOARD_ALIGNMENT.description: Sets the sensor board alignment angles.

payload.name: scale
payload.desc: Current sensor scale factor (`batteryMetersConfig()->current.scale`). Units depend on sensor type.

payload.name: capacity
payload.desc: Battery capacity (constrained 0-65535) (`currentBatteryProfile->capacity.value`). Note: This is legacy, use `MSP2_INAV_BATTERY_CONFIG` for full 32-bit capacity.

MSP_CURRENT_METER_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configuration for the current sensor.

MSP_SET_CURRENT_METER_CONFIG.description: Sets the configuration for the current sensor.

MSP_MIXER.notes: This command is largely obsolete. Mixer configuration is handled differently in INAV (presets, custom mixes). See `MSP2_INAV_MIXER`.
MSP_MIXER.description: Retrieves the mixer type (Legacy, INAV always returns QuadX).

payload.name: mixerMode
payload.desc: Mixer mode to set (ignored by INAV).

MSP_SET_MIXER.notes: Expects 1 byte. Calls `mixerUpdateStateFlags()` for potential side effects related to presets.
MSP_SET_MIXER.description: Sets the mixer type (Legacy, ignored by INAV).

payload.name: maxCheck
payload.desc: Upper channel value threshold for stick commands (`rxConfig()->maxcheck`).

payload.name: minCheck
payload.desc: Lower channel value threshold for stick commands (`rxConfig()->mincheck`).

MSP_RX_CONFIG.description: Retrieves receiver configuration settings. Some fields are Betaflight compatibility placeholders.

MSP_LED_COLORS.description: Retrieves the HSV color definitions for configurable LED colors.

MSP_SET_LED_COLORS.notes: Only available if `USE_LED_STRIP` is defined. Expects `LED_CONFIGURABLE_COLOR_COUNT * 4` bytes.
MSP_SET_LED_COLORS.description: Sets the HSV color definitions for configurable LED colors.

payload.name: legacyLedConfig
payload.desc: Packed LED configuration (position, function, overlay, color, direction, params). See C code for bit packing details.

MSP_LED_STRIP_CONFIG.notes: Only available if `USE_LED_STRIP` is defined. Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_LED_STRIP_CONFIG_EX` which uses a clearer struct.
MSP_LED_STRIP_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configuration for each LED on the strip (legacy packed format).

payload.name: ledIndex
payload.desc: Index of the LED to configure (0 to `LED_MAX_STRIP_LENGTH - 1`).

MSP_SET_LED_STRIP_CONFIG.notes: Only available if `USE_LED_STRIP` is defined. Expects 5 bytes. Calls `reevaluateLedConfig()`. Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_SET_LED_STRIP_CONFIG_EX`.
MSP_SET_LED_STRIP_CONFIG.description: Sets the configuration for a single LED on the strip using the legacy packed format.

payload.name: rssiChannel
payload.desc: AUX channel index (1-based) used for RSSI, or 0 if disabled (`rxConfig()->rssi_channel`).

MSP_RSSI_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the channel used for analog RSSI input.

payload.name: rssiChannel
payload.desc: AUX channel index (1-based) to use for RSSI, or 0 to disable.

MSP_SET_RSSI_CONFIG.notes: Expects 1 byte. Input value is constrained 0 to `MAX_SUPPORTED_RC_CHANNEL_COUNT`. Updates the effective RSSI source.
MSP_SET_RSSI_CONFIG.description: Sets the channel used for analog RSSI input.

payload.name: adjustmentIndex
payload.desc: Index of the adjustment slot (0 to `MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_ADJUSTMENT_COUNT - 1`).

payload.name: auxChannelIndex
payload.desc: 0-based index of the AUX channel controlling the adjustment value.

payload.name: rangeStartStep
payload.desc: Start step (0-20) of the control channel range.

payload.name: rangeEndStep
payload.desc: End step (0-20) of the control channel range.

payload.name: adjustmentFunction
payload.desc: Function/parameter being adjusted (e.g., PID gain, rate). See `rcAdjustments.h` enum.

payload.name: auxSwitchChannelIndex
payload.desc: 0-based index of the AUX channel acting as an enable switch (or 0 if always enabled).

MSP_ADJUSTMENT_RANGES.description: Returns all defined RC adjustment ranges (tuning via aux channels).

payload.name: rangeIndex
payload.desc: Index of the adjustment range to set (0 to `MAX_ADJUSTMENT_RANGE_COUNT - 1`).

payload.name: auxChannelIndex
payload.desc: 0-based index of the control AUX channel.

payload.name: auxSwitchChannelIndex
payload.desc: 0-based index of the enable switch AUX channel (or 0).

MSP_SET_ADJUSTMENT_RANGE.notes: Expects 7 bytes. Returns error if `rangeIndex` or `adjustmentIndex` is invalid.
MSP_SET_ADJUSTMENT_RANGE.description: Sets a single RC adjustment range configuration by its index.

MSP_CF_SERIAL_CONFIG.description: Deprecated command to get serial port configuration.

MSP_SET_CF_SERIAL_CONFIG.description: Deprecated command to set serial port configuration.

payload.name: vbatScale
payload.desc: Voltage sensor scale factor / 10 (`batteryMetersConfig()->voltage.scale / 10`). 0 if `USE_ADC` disabled.

MSP_VOLTAGE_METER_CONFIG.description: Retrieves legacy voltage meter configuration (scaled values).

MSP_SET_VOLTAGE_METER_CONFIG.description: Sets legacy voltage meter configuration (scaled values).

payload.name: rangefinderAltitude
payload.desc: Latest altitude reading from the rangefinder (`rangefinderGetLatestAltitude()`). 0 if `USE_RANGEFINDER` disabled or no reading.

MSP_SONAR_ALTITUDE.description: Retrieves the altitude measured by the primary rangefinder (sonar or lidar).

payload.name: rcMap
payload.desc: Array defining the mapping from input channel index to logical function (Roll, Pitch, Yaw, Throttle, Aux1...).

MSP_RX_MAP.description: Retrieves the RC channel mapping array (AETR, etc.).

payload.name: rcMap
payload.desc: Array defining the new channel mapping.

MSP_SET_RX_MAP.description: Sets the RC channel mapping array.

MSP_REBOOT.notes: The FC sends an ACK *before* rebooting. The `mspPostProcessFn` is set to `mspRebootFn` to perform the reboot after the reply is sent. Will fail if the craft is armed.
MSP_REBOOT.description: Commands the flight controller to reboot.

payload.name: flashReady
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if flash chip is ready, 0 otherwise. (`flashIsReady()`). 0 if `USE_FLASHFS` disabled.

payload.name: sectorCount
payload.desc: Total number of sectors on the flash chip (`geometry->sectors`). 0 if `USE_FLASHFS` disabled.

payload.name: totalSize
payload.desc: Total size of the flash chip in bytes (`geometry->totalSize`). 0 if `USE_FLASHFS` disabled.

payload.name: usedSize
payload.desc: Currently used size in bytes (FlashFS offset) (`flashfsGetOffset()`). 0 if `USE_FLASHFS` disabled.

MSP_DATAFLASH_SUMMARY.description: Retrieves summary information about the onboard dataflash chip (if present and used for Blackbox via FlashFS).

payload.name: address
payload.desc: Starting address to read from within the FlashFS volume.

payload.name: size
payload.desc: (Optional) Number of bytes to read. Defaults to 128 if not provided.

payload.name: address
payload.desc: The starting address from which data was actually read.

payload.name: data
payload.desc: The data read from flash. Length is MIN(requested size, remaining buffer space, remaining flashfs data).

MSP_DATAFLASH_READ.notes: Requires `USE_FLASHFS`. Read length may be truncated by buffer size or end of flashfs volume.
MSP_DATAFLASH_READ.description: Reads a block of data from the onboard dataflash (FlashFS).

MSP_DATAFLASH_ERASE.notes: Requires `USE_FLASHFS`. This is a potentially long operation. Use with caution.
MSP_DATAFLASH_ERASE.description: Erases the entire onboard dataflash chip (FlashFS volume).

MSP_LOOP_TIME.notes: This is the *configured* target loop time, not necessarily the *actual* measured cycle time (see `MSP_STATUS`).
MSP_LOOP_TIME.description: Retrieves the configured loop time (PID loop frequency denominator).

payload.name: failsafeOffDelay
payload.desc: Delay after signal recovery before returning control (`failsafeConfig()->failsafe_off_delay`).

payload.name: failsafeRecoveryDelay
payload.desc: Delay after RTH finishes before attempting recovery (`failsafeConfig()->failsafe_recovery_delay`).

payload.name: failsafeStickThreshold
payload.desc: Stick movement threshold to exit failsafe (`failsafeConfig()->failsafe_stick_motion_threshold`).

payload.name: failsafeMinDistance
payload.desc: Minimum distance from home for RTH failsafe (`failsafeConfig()->failsafe_min_distance`).

payload.name: failsafeMinDistanceProc
payload.desc: Failsafe procedure if below min distance (`failsafeConfig()->failsafe_min_distance_procedure`).

payload.name: sdCardSupported
payload.desc: Bitmask: Bit 0 = 1 if SD card support compiled in (`USE_SDCARD`).

payload.name: sdCardState
payload.desc: Enum (`mspSDCardState_e`): Current state (Not Present, Fatal, Card Init, FS Init, Ready). 0 if `USE_SDCARD` disabled.

payload.name: fsError
payload.desc: Last filesystem error code (`afatfs_getLastError()`). 0 if `USE_SDCARD` disabled.

payload.name: freeSpaceKB
payload.desc: Free space in KiB (`afatfs_getContiguousFreeSpace() / 1024`). 0 if `USE_SDCARD` disabled.

payload.name: totalSpaceKB
payload.desc: Total space in KiB (`sdcard_getMetadata()->numBlocks / 2`). 0 if `USE_SDCARD` disabled.

MSP_SDCARD_SUMMARY.description: Retrieves summary information about the SD card status and filesystem.

MSP_BLACKBOX_CONFIG.description: Legacy command to retrieve Blackbox configuration. Superseded by `MSP2_BLACKBOX_CONFIG`.

MSP_SET_BLACKBOX_CONFIG.description: Legacy command to set Blackbox configuration. Superseded by `MSP2_SET_BLACKBOX_CONFIG`.

MSP_TRANSPONDER_CONFIG.description: Get VTX Transponder settings (likely specific to RaceFlight/Betaflight, not standard INAV VTX).

payload.name: videoSystem
payload.desc: Video system (Auto/PAL/NTSC) (`osdConfig()->video_system`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: units
payload.desc: Measurement units (Metric/Imperial) (`osdConfig()->units`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: rssiAlarm
payload.desc: RSSI alarm threshold (`osdConfig()->rssi_alarm`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: capAlarm
payload.desc: Capacity alarm threshold (`currentBatteryProfile->capacity.warning`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: timerAlarm
payload.desc: Timer alarm threshold (`osdConfig()->time_alarm`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: altAlarm
payload.desc: Altitude alarm threshold (`osdConfig()->alt_alarm`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: distAlarm
payload.desc: Distance alarm threshold (`osdConfig()->dist_alarm`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: negAltAlarm
payload.desc: Negative altitude alarm threshold (`osdConfig()->neg_alt_alarm`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

payload.name: itemPositions
payload.desc: Packed X/Y position for each OSD item on screen 0 (`osdLayoutsConfig()->item_pos[0][i]`). Sent even if OSD disabled.

MSP_OSD_CONFIG.notes: Requires `USE_OSD` for meaningful data, but payload is always sent. Coordinates are packed: `(Y << 8) | X`. See `MSP2_INAV_OSD_*` commands for more detail and multi-layout support.
MSP_OSD_CONFIG.description: Retrieves OSD configuration settings and layout for screen 0.

MSP_SET_OSD_CONFIG.notes: Requires `USE_OSD`. Distinguishes formats based on the first byte. Format 1 requires at least 10 bytes. Format 2 requires 3 bytes. Triggers an OSD redraw. See `MSP2_INAV_OSD_SET_*` for more advanced control.
MSP_SET_OSD_CONFIG.description: Sets OSD configuration or a single item's position on screen 0.

MSP_OSD_CHAR_READ.notes: Not implemented in INAV `fc_msp.c`. Requires direct hardware access, typically done via DisplayPort.
MSP_OSD_CHAR_READ.description: Reads character data from the OSD font memory.

payload.name: address
payload.desc: Starting address in font memory. Size depends on total payload size.

payload.name: charData
payload.desc: Character bitmap data (54 or 64 bytes per char, depending on format).

MSP_OSD_CHAR_WRITE.notes: Requires `USE_OSD`. Payload size determines address size (8/16 bit) and character data size (visible bytes only or full char with metadata). Uses `displayWriteFontCharacter()`. Requires OSD hardware (like MAX7456) to be present and functional.
MSP_OSD_CHAR_WRITE.description: Writes character data to the OSD font memory.

payload.name: vtxDeviceType
payload.desc: Enum (`VTXDEV_*`): Type of VTX device detected/configured. `VTXDEV_UNKNOWN` if none.

payload.name: pitMode
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if VTX is currently in pit mode, 0 otherwise.

payload.name: vtxReady
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if VTX device reported ready, 0 otherwise.

payload.name: lowPowerDisarm
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if low power on disarm is enabled (from `vtxSettingsConfig`).

payload.name: vtxTableAvailable
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if VTX tables (band/power) are available for query.

payload.name: bandCount
payload.desc: Number of bands supported by the VTX device.

payload.name: channelCount
payload.desc: Number of channels per band supported by the VTX device.

payload.name: powerCount
payload.desc: Number of power levels supported by the VTX device.

MSP_VTX_CONFIG.notes: BF compatibility field `frequency` (uint16) is missing compared to some BF versions. Use `MSP_VTXTABLE_BAND` and `MSP_VTXTABLE_POWERLEVEL` for details.
MSP_VTX_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the current VTX (Video Transmitter) configuration and capabilities.

MSP_SET_VTX_CONFIG.notes: Requires `USE_VTX_CONTROL`. Minimum size 2 bytes. Applies settings to `vtxSettingsConfig` and potentially directly to the device (pit mode).
MSP_SET_VTX_CONFIG.description: Sets the VTX configuration (band, channel, power, pit mode). Supports multiple protocol versions/extensions based on payload size.

payload.name: useUnsyncedPwm
payload.desc: Always 1 (BF compatibility, INAV uses async PWM based on protocol).

MSP_ADVANCED_CONFIG.description: Retrieves advanced hardware-related configuration (PWM protocols, rates). Some fields are BF compatibility placeholders.

MSP_SET_ADVANCED_CONFIG.description: Sets advanced hardware-related configuration (PWM protocols, rates).

payload.name: gyroMainLpfHz
payload.desc: Gyro main low-pass filter cutoff frequency (`gyroConfig()->gyro_main_lpf_hz`).

MSP_FILTER_CONFIG.description: Retrieves filter configuration settings (Gyro, D-term, Yaw, Accel). Some fields are BF compatibility placeholders or legacy.

MSP_SET_FILTER_CONFIG.notes: Requires specific payload sizes (5, 9, 13, 17, 21, or 22 bytes) to be accepted. Calls `pidInitFilters()` if size >= 13.
MSP_SET_FILTER_CONFIG.description: Sets filter configuration settings. Handles different payload lengths for backward compatibility.

MSP_PID_ADVANCED.notes: Acceleration limits are scaled by 10 for compatibility.
MSP_PID_ADVANCED.description: Retrieves advanced PID tuning parameters. Many fields are BF compatibility placeholders.

payload.name: baroHardware
payload.desc: Enum (`baroHardware_e`): Barometer hardware type (`barometerConfig()->baro_hardware`). 0 if `USE_BARO` disabled.

payload.name: magHardware
payload.desc: Enum (`magHardware_e`): Magnetometer hardware type (`compassConfig()->mag_hardware`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: pitotHardware
payload.desc: Enum (`pitotHardware_e`): Pitot tube hardware type (`pitotmeterConfig()->pitot_hardware`). 0 if `USE_PITOT` disabled.

payload.name: rangefinderHardware
payload.desc: Enum (`rangefinderHardware_e`): Rangefinder hardware type (`rangefinderConfig()->rangefinder_hardware`). 0 if `USE_RANGEFINDER` disabled.

payload.name: opflowHardware
payload.desc: Enum (`opticalFlowHardware_e`): Optical flow hardware type (`opticalFlowConfig()->opflow_hardware`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

MSP_SENSOR_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configured hardware type for various sensors.

MSP_SET_SENSOR_CONFIG.description: Sets the configured hardware type for various sensors.

MSP_SPECIAL_PARAMETERS.description: Betaflight specific, likely unused/unimplemented in INAV.

MSP_SET_SPECIAL_PARAMETERS.description: Betaflight specific, likely unused/unimplemented in INAV.

MSP_IDENT.notes: Obsolete. Listed for legacy compatibility only.
MSP_IDENT.description: Provides basic flight controller identity information. Not implemented in modern INAV, but used by legacy versions and MultiWii.

payload.name: i2cErrors
payload.desc: Number of I2C errors encountered (`i2cGetErrorCounter()`). 0 if `USE_I2C` not defined.

payload.name: sensorStatus
payload.desc: Bitmask indicating available/active sensors (`packSensorStatus()`). See notes.

payload.name: activeModesLow
payload.desc: First 32 bits of the active flight modes bitmask (`packBoxModeFlags()`).

MSP_STATUS.notes: Superseded by `MSP_STATUS_EX` and `MSP2_INAV_STATUS`. `sensorStatus` bitmask: (Bit 0: ACC, 1: BARO, 2: MAG, 3: GPS, 4: RANGEFINDER, 5: GYRO). `activeModesLow` only contains the first 32 modes; use `MSP_ACTIVEBOXES` for the full set.
MSP_STATUS.description: Provides basic flight controller status including cycle time, errors, sensor status, active modes (first 32), and the current configuration profile.

payload.name: magX
payload.desc: Raw magnetometer X reading (`mag.magADC[X]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: magY
payload.desc: Raw magnetometer Y reading (`mag.magADC[Y]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

payload.name: magZ
payload.desc: Raw magnetometer Z reading (`mag.magADC[Z]`). 0 if `USE_MAG` disabled.

MSP_RAW_IMU.notes: Acc scaling is approximate (512 LSB/G). Mag units depend on the sensor.
MSP_RAW_IMU.description: Provides raw sensor readings from the IMU (Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Magnetometer).

payload.name: servoOutputs
payload.desc: Array of current servo output values (typically 1000-2000).

MSP_SERVO.description: Provides the current output values for all supported servos.

payload.name: motorOutputs
payload.desc: Array of current motor output values (typically 1000-2000). Values beyond `MAX_SUPPORTED_MOTORS` are 0.

MSP_MOTOR.description: Provides the current output values for the first 8 motors.

payload.name: rcChannels
payload.desc: Array of current RC channel values (typically 1000-2000). Length depends on detected channels.

MSP_RC.description: Provides the current values of the received RC channels.

payload.name: numSat
payload.desc: Number of satellites used in solution (`gpsSol.numSat`).

MSP_RAW_GPS.notes: Only available if `USE_GPS` is defined. Altitude is truncated to meters.
MSP_RAW_GPS.description: Provides raw GPS data (fix status, coordinates, altitude, speed, course).

payload.name: gpsHeartbeat
payload.desc: Indicates if GPS data is being received (`gpsSol.flags.gpsHeartbeat`).

MSP_COMP_GPS.description: Provides computed GPS values: distance and direction to home.

MSP_ATTITUDE.notes: Yaw is converted from deci-degrees to degrees.
MSP_ATTITUDE.description: Provides the current attitude estimate (roll, pitch, yaw).

payload.name: baroAltitude
payload.desc: Latest raw altitude from barometer (`baroGetLatestAltitude()`). 0 if `USE_BARO` disabled.

MSP_ALTITUDE.description: Provides estimated altitude, vertical speed (variometer), and raw barometric altitude.

payload.name: rssi
payload.desc: Received Signal Strength Indicator (`getRSSI()`). Units depend on source.

MSP_ANALOG.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_ANALOG` which provides higher precision and more fields.
MSP_ANALOG.description: Provides analog sensor readings: battery voltage, current consumption (mAh), RSSI, and current draw (Amps).

MSP_RC_TUNING.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_RATE_PROFILE` which includes manual rates/expos.
MSP_RC_TUNING.description: Retrieves RC tuning parameters (rates, expos, TPA) for the current control rate profile.

payload.name: activeModes
payload.desc: Bitmask of all active modes (`packBoxModeFlags()`). Size depends on `boxBitmask_t` definition.

MSP_ACTIVEBOXES.notes: Use this instead of `MSP_STATUS` or `MSP_STATUS_EX` if more than 32 modes are possible.
MSP_ACTIVEBOXES.description: Provides the full bitmask of currently active flight modes (boxes).

MSP_MISC.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_MISC` and other specific commands which offer better precision and more fields.
MSP_MISC.description: Retrieves miscellaneous configuration settings, mostly related to RC, GPS, Mag, and Battery voltage (legacy formats).

payload.name: boxNamesString
payload.desc: String containing mode names separated by ';'. Null termination not guaranteed by MSP, relies on payload size. (`serializeBoxNamesReply()`).

MSP_BOXNAMES.notes: The exact set of names depends on compiled features and configuration. Due to the size of the payload, it is recommended that [`MSP_BOXIDS`](#msp_boxids-119--0x77) is used instead.
MSP_BOXNAMES.description: Provides a semicolon-separated string containing the names of all available flight modes (boxes).

payload.name: pidNamesString
payload.desc: String "ROLL;PITCH;YAW;ALT;Pos;PosR;NavR;LEVEL;MAG;VEL;". Null termination not guaranteed by MSP.

MSP_PIDNAMES.description: Provides a semicolon-separated string containing the names of the PID controllers.

payload.name: waypointIndex
payload.desc: Index of the waypoint to retrieve (0 to `NAV_MAX_WAYPOINTS - 1`).

payload.name: altitude
payload.desc: Altitude coordinate (relative to home or sea level, see flag).

MSP_WP.description: Get/Set a single waypoint from the mission plan.

payload.name: boxIds
payload.desc: Array of permanent IDs for each configured box (`serializeBoxReply()`). Length depends on number of boxes.

MSP_BOXIDS.notes: Useful for mapping mode range configurations (`MSP_MODE_RANGES`) back to user-understandable modes via `MSP_BOXNAMES`.
MSP_BOXIDS.description: Provides a list of permanent IDs associated with the available flight modes (boxes).

MSP_SERVO_CONFIGURATIONS.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_SERVO_CONFIG` which has a cleaner structure.
MSP_SERVO_CONFIGURATIONS.description: Retrieves the configuration parameters for all supported servos (min, max, middle, rate). Legacy format with unused fields.

payload.name: navMode
payload.desc: Enum (`NAV_MODE_*`): Current navigation mode (None, RTH, WP, Hold, etc.) (`NAV_Status.mode`).

payload.name: activeWpAction
payload.desc: Enum (`navWaypointAction_e`): Action of the currently executing waypoint (`NAV_Status.activeWpAction`).

payload.name: activeWpNumber
payload.desc: Index: Index of the currently executing waypoint (`NAV_Status.activeWpNumber`).

payload.name: targetHeading
payload.desc: degrees: Target heading for heading controller (`getHeadingHoldTarget()`).

MSP_NAV_STATUS.description: Retrieves the current status of the navigation system.

MSP_3D.description: Retrieves settings related to 3D/reversible motor operation.

MSP_SENSOR_ALIGNMENT.notes: Board alignment is now typically handled by `MSP_BOARD_ALIGNMENT`. This returns legacy enum values where applicable.

payload.name: modeIndex
payload.desc: Index of the LED mode (`ledModeIndex_e`). `LED_MODE_COUNT` for special colors.

payload.name: directionOrSpecialIndex
payload.desc: Index of the direction (`ledDirection_e`) or special color (`ledSpecialColor_e`).

payload.name: colorIndex
payload.desc: Index of the color assigned from `ledStripConfig()->colors`.

MSP_LED_STRIP_MODECOLOR.notes: Only available if `USE_LED_STRIP` is defined. Allows mapping modes/directions/specials to configured colors.
MSP_LED_STRIP_MODECOLOR.description: Retrieves the color index assigned to each LED mode and function/direction combination, including special colors.

MSP_BATTERY_STATE.notes: Only available if `USE_DJI_HD_OSD` or `USE_MSP_DISPLAYPORT` is defined. Some values are duplicated from `MSP_ANALOG` / `MSP2_INAV_ANALOG` but potentially with different scaling/types.
MSP_BATTERY_STATE.description: Provides battery state information, formatted primarily for DJI FPV Goggles compatibility.

MSP_VTXTABLE_BAND.notes: The ID is defined, but no handler exists in the provided C code. Likely intended to query band names and frequencies.
MSP_VTXTABLE_BAND.description: Retrieves information about a specific VTX band from the VTX table. (Implementation missing in provided `fc_msp.c`)

payload.name: powerLevelIndex
payload.desc: 1-based index of the power level to query.

payload.name: powerLevelIndex
payload.desc: 1-based index of the returned power level.

payload.name: powerValue
payload.desc: Always 0 (Actual power value in mW is not stored/returned via MSP).

payload.name: labelLength
payload.desc: Length of the power level label string that follows.

payload.name: label
payload.desc: Power level label string (e.g., "25", "200"). Length given by previous field.

MSP_VTXTABLE_POWERLEVEL.notes: Requires `USE_VTX_CONTROL`. Returns error if index is out of bounds. The `powerValue` field is unused.
MSP_VTXTABLE_POWERLEVEL.description: Retrieves information about a specific VTX power level from the VTX table.

payload.name: rcChannels
payload.desc: Array of RC channel values (typically 1000-2000). Number of channels determined by payload size.

MSP_SET_RAW_RC.description: Provides raw RC channel data to the flight controller, typically used when the receiver is connected via MSP (e.g., MSP RX feature).

payload.name: groundCourse
payload.desc: Ground course (units unclear from code, likely degrees or deci-degrees, ignored in current code).

MSP_SET_RAW_GPS.notes: Requires `USE_GPS`. Expects 14 bytes. Updates `gpsSol` structure and calls `onNewGPSData()`. Note the altitude unit mismatch (meters in MSP, cm internal). Does not provide velocity components.
MSP_SET_RAW_GPS.description: Provides raw GPS data to the flight controller, typically for simulation or external GPS injection.

MSP_SET_BOX.notes: Not implemented in INAV `fc_msp.c`. Mode changes are typically handled via RC channels (`MSP_MODE_RANGES`).
MSP_SET_BOX.description: Sets the state of flight modes (boxes). (Likely unused/obsolete in INAV).

MSP_SET_RC_TUNING.notes: Expects 10 or 11 bytes. Calls `schedulePidGainsUpdate()`. Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_SET_RATE_PROFILE`.
MSP_SET_RC_TUNING.description: Sets RC tuning parameters (rates, expos, TPA) for the current control rate profile.

MSP_MAG_CALIBRATION.notes: Will fail if armed. Enables the `CALIBRATE_MAG` state flag.

MSP_RESET_CONF.notes: Will fail if armed. Suspends RX, calls `resetEEPROM()`, `writeEEPROM()`, `readEEPROM()`, resumes RX. Use with caution!
MSP_RESET_CONF.description: Resets all configuration settings to their default values and saves to EEPROM.

payload.name: waypointIndex
payload.desc: Index of the waypoint to set (0 to `NAV_MAX_WAYPOINTS - 1`).

MSP_SET_WP.notes: Expects 21 bytes. Calls `setWaypoint()`. If `USE_FW_AUTOLAND` is enabled, this also interacts with autoland approach settings based on waypoint index and flags.
MSP_SET_WP.description: Sets a single waypoint in the mission plan.

payload.name: profileIndex
payload.desc: Index of the profile to activate (0-based).

MSP_SELECT_SETTING.description: Selects the active configuration profile and saves it.

MSP_SET_HEAD.description: Sets the target heading for the heading hold controller (e.g., during MAG mode).

payload.name: servoIndex
payload.desc: Index of the servo to configure (0 to `MAX_SUPPORTED_SERVOS - 1`).

MSP_SET_SERVO_CONFIGURATION.notes: Expects 15 bytes. Returns error if index is invalid. Calls `servoComputeScalingFactors()`. Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_SET_SERVO_CONFIG`.
MSP_SET_SERVO_CONFIGURATION.description: Sets the configuration for a single servo (legacy format).

payload.name: motorValues
payload.desc: Array of motor values to set when disarmed. Only affects first `MAX_SUPPORTED_MOTORS`.

MSP_SET_MOTOR.notes: Expects 16 bytes. Modifies the `motor_disarmed` array. These values are *not* saved persistently.
MSP_SET_MOTOR.description: Sets the disarmed motor values, typically used for motor testing or propeller balancing functions in a configurator.

MSP_SET_3D.notes: Expects 6 bytes. Requires reversible motor support.
MSP_SET_3D.description: Sets parameters related to 3D/reversible motor operation.

MSP_SET_RESET_CURR_PID.description: Resets the PIDs of the *current* profile to their default values. Does not save.

MSP_SET_SENSOR_ALIGNMENT.notes: Expects 4 bytes. Use `MSP_SET_BOARD_ALIGNMENT` for primary board orientation.

payload.name: modeIndex
payload.desc: Index of the LED mode (`ledModeIndex_e` or `LED_MODE_COUNT` for special).

payload.name: directionOrSpecialIndex
payload.desc: Index of the direction or special color.

payload.name: colorIndex
payload.desc: Index of the color to assign from `ledStripConfig()->colors`.

MSP_SET_LED_STRIP_MODECOLOR.notes: Only available if `USE_LED_STRIP` is defined. Expects 3 bytes. Returns error if setting fails (invalid index).
MSP_SET_LED_STRIP_MODECOLOR.description: Sets the color index for a specific LED mode/function combination.

MSP_SET_ACC_TRIM.description: Sets the accelerometer trim values (leveling calibration).

MSP_ACC_TRIM.notes: Not implemented in INAV `fc_msp.c`. Calibration data via `MSP_CALIBRATION_DATA`.

payload.name: inputSource
payload.desc: Input source for the mix (RC chan, Roll, Pitch...). See `mixerSource_t`.

MSP_SERVO_MIX_RULES.description: Retrieves the custom servo mixer rules (legacy format).

payload.name: ruleIndex
payload.desc: Index of the rule to set (0 to `MAX_SERVO_RULES - 1`).

MSP_SET_SERVO_MIX_RULE.notes: Expects 9 bytes. Returns error if index invalid. Calls `loadCustomServoMixer()`. Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_SET_SERVO_MIXER`.
MSP_SET_SERVO_MIX_RULE.description: Sets a single custom servo mixer rule (legacy format).

payload.name: status
payload.desc: 1 if passthrough started successfully, 0 on error (e.g., port not found). For 4way, returns number of ESCs found.

MSP_SET_PASSTHROUGH.notes: If successful, sets `mspPostProcessFn` to the appropriate handler (`mspSerialPassthroughFn` or `esc4wayProcess`). This handler takes over the serial port after the reply is sent. Requires `USE_SERIAL_4WAY_BLHELI_INTERFACE` for ESC passthrough.
MSP_SET_PASSTHROUGH.description: Enables serial passthrough mode to peripherals like ESCs (BLHeli 4-way) or other serial devices.

payload.name: seconds
payload.desc: Seconds since epoch (or relative time if not set). 0 if RTC time unknown.

payload.name: millis
payload.desc: Millisecond part of the time. 0 if RTC time unknown.

MSP_RTC.notes: Requires RTC hardware/support. Returns (0, 0) if time is not available/set.
MSP_RTC.description: Retrieves the current Real-Time Clock time.

payload.name: seconds
payload.desc: Seconds component of time to set.

payload.name: millis
payload.desc: Millisecond component of time to set.

MSP_SET_RTC.notes: Requires RTC hardware/support. Expects 6 bytes. Uses `rtcSet()`.

MSP_EEPROM_WRITE.notes: Will fail if armed. Suspends RX, calls `writeEEPROM()`, `readEEPROM()`, resumes RX.
MSP_EEPROM_WRITE.description: Saves the current configuration from RAM to non-volatile memory (EEPROM/Flash).

MSP_DEBUGMSG.description: Retrieves debug ("serial printf") messages from the firmware.

MSP_DEBUG.notes: Useful for developers. See `MSP2_INAV_DEBUG` for 32-bit values.
MSP_DEBUG.description: Retrieves values from the firmware's `debug[]` array (legacy 16-bit version).

MSP_V2_FRAME.notes: See MSPv2 documentation for the actual frame structure that follows this indicator.
MSP_V2_FRAME.description: This ID is used as a *payload indicator* within an MSPv1 message structure (`$M>`) to signify that the following payload conforms to the MSPv2 format. It's not a command itself.

payload.name: armingFlags
payload.desc: Flight controller arming flags (`armingFlags`). Note: Truncated to 16 bits.

MSP_STATUS_EX.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_STATUS` which provides the full 32-bit `armingFlags` and other enhancements.
MSP_STATUS_EX.description: Provides extended flight controller status, including CPU load, arming flags, and calibration status, in addition to `MSP_STATUS` fields.

payload.name: overallHealth
payload.desc: 1 if all essential hardware is healthy, 0 otherwise (`isHardwareHealthy()`).

MSP_SENSOR_STATUS.notes: Status values likely correspond to `SENSOR_STATUS_*` enums (e.g., OK, Unhealthy, Not Present).
MSP_SENSOR_STATUS.description: Provides the hardware status for each individual sensor system.

payload.name: uid0
payload.desc: First 32 bits of the unique ID (`U_ID_0`).

payload.name: uid1
payload.desc: Middle 32 bits of the unique ID (`U_ID_1`).

payload.name: uid2
payload.desc: Last 32 bits of the unique ID (`U_ID_2`).

MSP_UID.notes: Total 12 bytes, representing a 96-bit unique ID.
MSP_UID.description: Provides the unique identifier of the microcontroller.

payload.name: numChannels
payload.desc: Always 0 (Number of SV info channels reported).

MSP_GPSSVINFO.notes: Requires `USE_GPS`. This is just a stub in INAV and does not provide actual per-satellite signal info. `hdopUnits` duplicates `hdopHundreds`.
MSP_GPSSVINFO.description: Provides satellite signal strength information (legacy U-Blox compatibility stub).

payload.name: lastMessageDt
payload.desc: Time since last valid GPS message (`gpsStats.lastMessageDt`).

payload.name: packetCount
payload.desc: Number of valid GPS packets received (`gpsStats.packetCount`).

MSP_GPSSTATISTICS.description: Provides debugging statistics for the GPS communication link.

payload.name: rssiSource
payload.desc: Enum: Source of the RSSI value (`getRSSISource()`).

payload.name: rtcDateTimeIsSet
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if the RTC has been set, 0 otherwise.

MSP_TX_INFO.description: Provides information potentially useful for transmitter LUA scripts.

payload.name: rssi
payload.desc: RSSI value (0-100) provided by the external source.

MSP_SET_TX_INFO.description: Allows a transmitter LUA script (or similar) to send runtime information (currently only RSSI) to the firmware.

MSP2_COMMON_TZ.description: Gets the time zone offset configuration.

MSP2_COMMON_SET_TZ.description: Sets the time zone offset configuration.

payload.name: settingName
payload.desc: Null-terminated string containing the setting name (e.g., "gyro_main_lpf_hz").

payload.name: settingValue
payload.desc: Raw byte value of the setting. Size depends on the setting's type (`settingGetValueSize()`).

MSP2_COMMON_SETTING.notes: Returns error if setting not found. Use `MSP2_COMMON_SETTING_INFO` to discover settings, types, and sizes.
MSP2_COMMON_SETTING.description: Gets the value of a specific configuration setting, identified by name or index.

payload.name: settingIdentifier
payload.desc: Setting name (null-terminated string) OR Index (0x00 followed by `uint16_t` index).

payload.name: settingValue
payload.desc: Raw byte value to set for the setting. Size must match the setting's type.

MSP2_COMMON_SET_SETTING.notes: Performs type checking and range validation (min/max). Returns error if setting not found, value size mismatch, or value out of range. Handles different data types (`uint8`, `int16`, `float`, `string`, etc.) internally.
MSP2_COMMON_SET_SETTING.description: Sets the value of a specific configuration setting, identified by name or index.

MSP2_COMMON_MOTOR_MIXER.description: Retrieves the current motor mixer configuration (throttle, roll, pitch, yaw weights for each motor) for the primary and secondary mixer profiles.

payload.name: motorIndex
payload.desc: Index of the motor to configure (0 to `MAX_SUPPORTED_MOTORS - 1`).

MSP2_COMMON_SET_MOTOR_MIXER.notes: Expects 9 bytes. Modifies `primaryMotorMixerMutable()`. Returns error if index is invalid.
MSP2_COMMON_SET_MOTOR_MIXER.description: Sets the motor mixer weights for a single motor in the primary mixer profile.

payload.name: profileCount
payload.desc: Total number of profiles (if applicable, else 0).

payload.name: lookupNames
payload.desc: (If `mode == MODE_LOOKUP`) Series of null-terminated strings for each possible value from min to max.

payload.name: settingValue
payload.desc: Current raw byte value of the setting.

MSP2_COMMON_SETTING_INFO.description: Gets detailed information about a specific configuration setting (name, type, range, flags, current value, etc.).

payload.name: pgn
payload.desc: PGN ID to query. If omitted, returns all used PGNs.

payload.name: startIndex
payload.desc: Absolute index of the first setting in this group.

payload.name: endIndex
payload.desc: Absolute index of the last setting in this group.

MSP2_COMMON_PG_LIST.notes: Allows efficient fetching of related settings by group.
MSP2_COMMON_PG_LIST.description: Gets a list of Parameter Group Numbers (PGNs) used by settings, along with the start and end setting indexes for each group. Can request info for a single PGN.

payload.name: mspBaudIndex
payload.desc: Baud rate index for MSP function.

payload.name: gpsBaudIndex
payload.desc: Baud rate index for GPS function.

payload.name: telemetryBaudIndex
payload.desc: Baud rate index for Telemetry function.

payload.name: peripheralBaudIndex
payload.desc: Baud rate index for other peripheral functions.

MSP2_COMMON_SERIAL_CONFIG.notes: Baud rate indexes map to actual baud rates (e.g., 9600, 115200). See `baudRates` array.
MSP2_COMMON_SERIAL_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configuration for all available serial ports.

MSP2_COMMON_SET_SERIAL_CONFIG.notes: Payload size must be a multiple of the size of one port config entry (1 + 4 + 4 = 9 bytes). Returns error if identifier is invalid or size is incorrect. Baud rate indexes are constrained `BAUD_MIN` to `BAUD_MAX`.
MSP2_COMMON_SET_SERIAL_CONFIG.description: Sets the configuration for one or more serial ports.

payload.name: poiIndex
payload.desc: Index of the POI slot (0 to `RADAR_MAX_POIS - 1`).

MSP2_COMMON_SET_RADAR_POS.description: Sets the position and status information for a "radar" Point of Interest (POI). Used for displaying other craft/objects on the OSD map.

MSP2_COMMON_SET_RADAR_ITD.description: Sets radar information to display (likely internal/unused).

payload.name: validLink
payload.desc: Indicates if the link is currently valid (not in failsafe).

payload.name: uplinkRSSI_dBm
payload.desc: Uplink RSSI in dBm (sent as positive, e.g., 70 means -70dBm).

MSP2_COMMON_SET_MSP_RC_LINK_STATS.notes: Requires `USE_RX_MSP`. Expects at least 7 bytes. Updates `rxLinkStatistics` and sets RSSI via `setRSSIFromMSP_RC()` only if `sublinkID` is 0. This message expects **no reply** (`MSP_RESULT_NO_REPLY`).
MSP2_COMMON_SET_MSP_RC_LINK_STATS.description: Provides RC link statistics (RSSI, LQ) to the FC, typically from an MSP-based RC link (like ExpressLRS). Sent periodically by the RC link.

MSP2_COMMON_SET_MSP_RC_INFO.notes: Requires `USE_RX_MSP`. Expects at least 15 bytes. Updates `rxLinkStatistics` only if `sublinkID` is 0. Converts band/mode strings to uppercase. This message expects **no reply** (`MSP_RESULT_NO_REPLY`).
MSP2_COMMON_SET_MSP_RC_INFO.description: Provides additional RC link information (power levels, band, mode) to the FC from an MSP-based RC link. Sent less frequently than link stats.

payload.name: profileAndBattProfile
payload.desc: Bits 0-3: Config profile index (`getConfigProfile()`), Bits 4-7: Battery profile index (`getConfigBatteryProfile()`).

payload.name: activeModes
payload.desc: Full bitmask of active flight modes (`packBoxModeFlags()`).

MSP2_INAV_STATUS.description: Provides comprehensive flight controller status, extending `MSP_STATUS_EX` with full arming flags, battery profile, and mixer profile.

payload.name: quality
payload.desc: Raw quality indicator from the sensor (`opflow.rawQuality`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

payload.name: flowRateX
payload.desc: Optical flow rate X (roll axis) (`RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(opflow.flowRate[X])`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

payload.name: flowRateY
payload.desc: Optical flow rate Y (pitch axis) (`RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(opflow.flowRate[Y])`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

payload.name: bodyRateX
payload.desc: Compensated body rate X (roll axis) (`RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(opflow.bodyRate[X])`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

payload.name: bodyRateY
payload.desc: Compensated body rate Y (pitch axis) (`RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(opflow.bodyRate[Y])`). 0 if `USE_OPFLOW` disabled.

MSP2_INAV_OPTICAL_FLOW.description: Provides data from the optical flow sensor.

payload.name: batteryFlags
payload.desc: Battery status flags: Bit 0=Full on plug-in, Bit 1=Use capacity threshold, Bit 2-3=Battery State enum (`getBatteryState()`), Bit 4-7=Cell Count (`getBatteryCellCount()`).

MSP2_INAV_ANALOG.description: Provides detailed analog sensor readings, superseding `MSP_ANALOG` with higher precision and additional fields.

MSP2_INAV_MISC.description: Retrieves miscellaneous configuration settings, superseding `MSP_MISC` with higher precision and capacity fields.

payload.name: capacityUnit
payload.desc: Sets `batteryMetersConfigMutable()->capacity_unit` (validated). Updates OSD energy unit if changed.

MSP2_INAV_SET_MISC.notes: Expects 41 bytes. Performs validation on `vbatSource` and `capacityUnit`.

MSP2_INAV_BATTERY_CONFIG.notes: Fields are 0 if `USE_ADC` is not defined.
MSP2_INAV_BATTERY_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configuration specific to the battery voltage and current sensors and capacity settings for the current battery profile.

payload.name: capacityUnit
payload.desc: Sets `batteryMetersConfigMutable()->capacity_unit` (validated). Updates OSD energy unit if changed.

MSP2_INAV_SET_BATTERY_CONFIG.notes: Expects 29 bytes. Performs validation on `vbatSource` and `capacityUnit`.
MSP2_INAV_SET_BATTERY_CONFIG.description: Sets the battery voltage/current sensor configuration and capacity settings for the current battery profile.

MSP2_INAV_RATE_PROFILE.description: Retrieves the rates and expos for the current control rate profile, including both stabilized and manual flight modes. Supersedes `MSP_RC_TUNING`.

MSP2_INAV_SET_RATE_PROFILE.notes: Expects 15 bytes. Constraints applied to rates based on axis.
MSP2_INAV_SET_RATE_PROFILE.description: Sets the rates and expos for the current control rate profile (stabilized and manual). Supersedes `MSP_SET_RC_TUNING`.

payload.name: airspeed
payload.desc: Estimated/measured airspeed (`getAirspeedEstimate()`). 0 if `USE_PITOT` disabled or no valid data.

MSP2_INAV_AIR_SPEED.notes: Requires `USE_PITOT` for measured airspeed. May return GPS ground speed if pitot unavailable but GPS is present and configured.
MSP2_INAV_AIR_SPEED.description: Retrieves the estimated or measured airspeed.

MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING.notes: Superseded by `MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT2`. Only includes timers *not* used for PPM/PWM input.
MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING.description: Retrieves the output mapping configuration (identifies which timer outputs are used for Motors/Servos). Legacy version sending only 8-bit usage flags.

payload.name: brakingBankAngle
payload.desc: Maximum bank angle allowed during braking (`navConfig()->mc.braking_bank_angle`).

MSP2_INAV_MC_BRAKING.notes: Payload is empty if `USE_MR_BRAKING_MODE` is not defined.
MSP2_INAV_MC_BRAKING.description: Retrieves configuration parameters for the multirotor braking mode feature.

MSP2_INAV_SET_MC_BRAKING.notes: Expects 14 bytes. Returns error if `USE_MR_BRAKING_MODE` is not defined.
MSP2_INAV_SET_MC_BRAKING.description: Sets configuration parameters for the multirotor braking mode feature.

payload.name: timerId
payload.desc: Hardware timer identifier (e.g., `TIM1`, `TIM2`). Value depends on target.

MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT.notes: Usage flags are truncated to 8 bits. `timerId` mapping is target-specific.
MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT.description: Retrieves extended output mapping configuration (timer ID and usage flags). Obsolete, use `MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT2`.

MSP2_INAV_TIMER_OUTPUT_MODE.notes: Only available on non-SITL builds. `HARDWARE_TIMER_DEFINITION_COUNT` varies by target.
MSP2_INAV_TIMER_OUTPUT_MODE.description: Get or list the output mode override for hardware timers (e.g., force ONESHOT, DSHOT).

payload.name: timerIndex
payload.desc: Index of the hardware timer definition.

payload.name: outputMode
payload.desc: Output mode override (`TIMER_OUTPUT_MODE_*` enum) to set.

MSP2_INAV_SET_TIMER_OUTPUT_MODE.notes: Only available on non-SITL builds. Expects 2 bytes. Returns error if `timerIndex` is invalid.
MSP2_INAV_SET_TIMER_OUTPUT_MODE.description: Set the output mode override for a specific hardware timer.

payload.name: timerId
payload.desc: Hardware timer identifier (e.g., `TIM1`, `TIM2`). SITL uses index.

payload.name: pinLabel
payload.desc: Label for special pin usage (`PIN_LABEL_*` enum, e.g., `PIN_LABEL_LED`). 0 (`PIN_LABEL_NONE`) otherwise.

MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT2.notes: Provides complete usage flags and helps identify pins repurposed for functions like LED strip.
MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT2.description: Retrieves the full extended output mapping configuration (timer ID, full 32-bit usage flags, and pin label). Supersedes `MSP2_INAV_OUTPUT_MAPPING_EXT`.

payload.name: motorDirectionInverted
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if motor direction is reversed globally (`mixerConfig()->motorDirectionInverted`).

payload.name: motorStopOnLow
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if motors stop at minimum throttle (`mixerConfig()->motorstopOnLow`).

payload.name: platformType
payload.desc: Enum (`platformType_e`): Vehicle platform type (Multirotor, Airplane, etc.) (`mixerConfig()->platformType`).

payload.name: hasFlaps
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if the current mixer configuration includes flaps (`mixerConfig()->hasFlaps`).

payload.name: itemCount
payload.desc: Number of OSD items per layout (`OSD_ITEM_COUNT`).

MSP2_INAV_OSD_LAYOUTS.notes: Requires `USE_OSD`. Returns error if indexes are invalid.
MSP2_INAV_OSD_LAYOUTS.description: Gets OSD layout information (counts, positions for a specific layout, or position for a specific item).

payload.name: layoutIndex
payload.desc: Index of the OSD layout (0 to `OSD_LAYOUT_COUNT - 1`).

payload.name: itemIndex
payload.desc: Index of the OSD item (`OSD_ITEM_*` enum).

MSP2_INAV_OSD_SET_LAYOUT_ITEM.notes: Requires `USE_OSD`. Expects 4 bytes. Returns error if indexes are invalid. If the modified layout is not the currently active one, it temporarily overrides the active layout for 10 seconds to show the change. Otherwise, triggers a full OSD redraw.
MSP2_INAV_OSD_SET_LAYOUT_ITEM.description: Sets the position of a single OSD item within a specific layout.

payload.name: currentAlarm
payload.desc: Current draw alarm threshold (`osdConfig()->current_alarm`). Units may need verification.

payload.name: baroTempMinAlarm
payload.desc: Min Baro temperature alarm (`osdConfig()->baro_temp_alarm_min`). 0 if `USE_BARO` disabled.

payload.name: baroTempMaxAlarm
payload.desc: Max Baro temperature alarm (`osdConfig()->baro_temp_alarm_max`). 0 if `USE_BARO` disabled.

MSP2_INAV_OSD_SET_ALARMS.notes: Requires `USE_OSD`. Expects 24 bytes. ADSB alarms are not settable via this message.

payload.name: mainVoltageDecimals
payload.desc: Count: Decimal places for main voltage display (`osdConfig()->main_voltage_decimals`).

payload.name: ahiReverseRoll
payload.desc: Boolean: Reverse roll direction on Artificial Horizon (`osdConfig()->ahi_reverse_roll`).

payload.name: crosshairsStyle
payload.desc: Enum: Style of the center crosshairs (`osdConfig()->crosshairs_style`).

payload.name: leftSidebarScroll
payload.desc: Boolean: Enable scrolling for left sidebar (`osdConfig()->left_sidebar_scroll`).

payload.name: rightSidebarScroll
payload.desc: Boolean: Enable scrolling for right sidebar (`osdConfig()->right_sidebar_scroll`).

payload.name: sidebarScrollArrows
payload.desc: Boolean: Show arrows for scrollable sidebars (`osdConfig()->sidebar_scroll_arrows`).

payload.name: statsEnergyUnit
payload.desc: Enum: Unit for energy display in post-flight stats (`osdConfig()->stats_energy_unit`).

MSP2_INAV_OSD_PREFERENCES.description: Retrieves OSD display preferences (video system, units, styles, etc.).

MSP2_INAV_OSD_SET_PREFERENCES.notes: Requires `USE_OSD`. Expects 9 bytes. Triggers a full OSD redraw.

payload.name: batteryProfileIndex
payload.desc: Index of the battery profile to activate (0-based).

MSP2_INAV_SELECT_BATTERY_PROFILE.notes: Expects 1 byte. Will fail if armed. Calls `setConfigBatteryProfileAndWriteEEPROM()`.
MSP2_INAV_SELECT_BATTERY_PROFILE.description: Selects the active battery profile and saves configuration.

MSP2_INAV_DEBUG.description: Retrieves values from the firmware's 32-bit `debug[]` array. Supersedes `MSP_DEBUG`.

payload.name: blackboxSupported
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if Blackbox is supported (`USE_BLACKBOX`), 0 otherwise.

payload.name: blackboxDevice
payload.desc: Enum (`blackboxDevice_e`): Target device for logging (`blackboxConfig()->device`). 0 if not supported.

payload.name: blackboxRateNum
payload.desc: Numerator for logging rate divider (`blackboxConfig()->rate_num`). 0 if not supported.

payload.name: blackboxRateDenom
payload.desc: Denominator for logging rate divider (`blackboxConfig()->rate_denom`). 0 if not supported.

payload.name: blackboxIncludeFlags
payload.desc: Bitmask: Flags for fields included/excluded from logging (`blackboxConfig()->includeFlags`).

MSP2_SET_BLACKBOX_CONFIG.notes: Requires `USE_BLACKBOX`. Expects 9 bytes. Returns error if Blackbox is currently logging (`!blackboxMayEditConfig()`).

payload.name: type
payload.desc: Enum (`tempSensorType_e`): Type of the temperature sensor.

payload.name: osdSymbol
payload.desc: Index: OSD symbol to use for this sensor (0 to `TEMP_SENSOR_SYM_COUNT`).

MSP2_INAV_TEMP_SENSOR_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configuration for all onboard temperature sensors.

MSP2_INAV_SET_TEMP_SENSOR_CONFIG.description: Sets the configuration for all onboard temperature sensors.

payload.name: temperature
payload.desc: Current temperature reading. -1000 if sensor is invalid or reading failed.

MSP2_INAV_TEMPERATURES.description: Retrieves the current readings from all configured temperature sensors.

payload.name: stabilizedThrottle
payload.desc: Stabilized Throttle command output (-500 to 500 if armed, else -500).

payload.name: debugFlags
payload.desc: Packed flags: Debug index (0-7), Platform type, Armed state, OSD feature status.

payload.name: osdRows
payload.desc: (If OSD supported) Number of OSD rows.

payload.name: osdCols
payload.desc: (If OSD supported) Number of OSD columns.

payload.name: osdStartY
payload.desc: (If OSD supported) Starting row for RLE data.

payload.name: osdStartX
payload.desc: (If OSD supported) Starting column for RLE data.

payload.name: osdRleData
payload.desc: (If OSD supported) Run-length encoded OSD character data. Terminated by `[0, 0]`.

MSP_SIMULATOR.notes: Requires `USE_SIMULATOR`. Complex message handling state changes for enabling/disabling HITL. Sensor data is injected directly. OSD data is sent using a custom RLE scheme. See `simulatorData` struct and associated code for details.
MSP_SIMULATOR.description: Handles Hardware-in-the-Loop (HITL) simulation data exchange. Receives simulated sensor data and options, sends back control outputs and debug info.

MSP2_INAV_SERVO_MIXER.description: Retrieves the custom servo mixer rules, including programming framework condition IDs, for primary and secondary mixer profiles. Supersedes `MSP_SERVO_MIX_RULES`.

payload.name: ruleIndex
payload.desc: Index of the rule to set (0 to `MAX_SERVO_RULES - 1`).

payload.name: conditionId
payload.desc: Logic Condition ID (255/-1 if none). Ignored if `USE_PROGRAMMING_FRAMEWORK` is disabled.

MSP2_INAV_SET_SERVO_MIXER.notes: Expects 7 bytes. Returns error if index invalid. Calls `loadCustomServoMixer()`.
MSP2_INAV_SET_SERVO_MIXER.description: Sets a single custom servo mixer rule, including programming framework condition ID. Supersedes `MSP_SET_SERVO_MIX_RULE`.

payload.name: enabled
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if the condition is enabled.

payload.name: activatorId
payload.desc: ID of the activator condition (if any, 255 if none).

payload.name: operation
payload.desc: Enum (`logicConditionOp_e`): Logical operation (AND, OR, XOR, etc.).

payload.name: operandAType
payload.desc: Enum (`logicOperandType_e`): Type of the first operand (Flight Mode, GVAR, etc.).

payload.name: operandBType
payload.desc: Enum (`logicOperandType_e`): Type of the second operand.

MSP2_INAV_LOGIC_CONDITIONS.description: Retrieves the configuration of all defined Logic Conditions.

payload.name: conditionIndex
payload.desc: Index of the condition to set (0 to `MAX_LOGIC_CONDITIONS - 1`).

MSP2_INAV_SET_LOGIC_CONDITIONS.notes: Requires `USE_PROGRAMMING_FRAMEWORK`. Expects 15 bytes. Returns error if index is invalid.
MSP2_INAV_SET_LOGIC_CONDITIONS.description: Sets the configuration for a single Logic Condition by its index.

payload.name: conditionValues
payload.desc: Array of current values for each logic condition (`logicConditionGetValue(i)`). 1 for true, 0 for false, or numerical value depending on operation.

MSP2_INAV_LOGIC_CONDITIONS_STATUS.description: Retrieves the current evaluated status (true/false or numerical value) of all logic conditions.

payload.name: gvarValues
payload.desc: Array of current values for each global variable (`gvGet(i)`).

MSP2_INAV_GVAR_STATUS.description: Retrieves the current values of all Global Variables (GVARS).

payload.name: enabled
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if the PID is enabled.

payload.name: setpointType
payload.desc: Enum (`logicOperandType_e`): Type of the setpoint source.

payload.name: measurementType
payload.desc: Enum (`logicOperandType_e`): Type of the measurement source.

MSP2_INAV_PROGRAMMING_PID.description: Retrieves the configuration of all Programming PIDs.

payload.name: pidIndex
payload.desc: Index of the Programming PID to set (0 to `MAX_PROGRAMMING_PID_COUNT - 1`).

payload.name: setpointType
payload.desc: Enum: Type of the setpoint source.

payload.name: measurementType
payload.desc: Enum: Type of the measurement source.

MSP2_INAV_SET_PROGRAMMING_PID.notes: Requires `USE_PROGRAMMING_FRAMEWORK`. Expects 20 bytes. Returns error if index is invalid.
MSP2_INAV_SET_PROGRAMMING_PID.description: Sets the configuration for a single Programming PID by its index.

payload.name: pidOutputs
payload.desc: Array of current output values for each Programming PID (`programmingPidGetOutput(i)`).

MSP2_INAV_PROGRAMMING_PID_STATUS.description: Retrieves the current output value of all Programming PIDs.

MSP2_PID.notes: `PID_ITEM_COUNT` defines the number of standard PID controllers (Roll, Pitch, Yaw, Alt, Vel, etc.). Updates from EZ-Tune if enabled.
MSP2_PID.description: Retrieves the standard PID controller gains (P, I, D, FF) for the current PID profile.

MSP2_SET_PID.description: Sets the standard PID controller gains (P, I, D, FF) for the current PID profile.

MSP2_INAV_OPFLOW_CALIBRATION.notes: Requires `USE_OPFLOW`. Will fail if armed. Calls `opflowStartCalibration()`.
MSP2_INAV_OPFLOW_CALIBRATION.description: Starts the optical flow sensor calibration procedure.

payload.name: firmwareSize
payload.desc: Total size of the incoming firmware file in bytes.

MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_PREPARE.notes: Requires `MSP_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`. Expects 4 bytes. Returns error if preparation fails (e.g., no storage, invalid size). Calls `firmwareUpdatePrepare()`.
MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_PREPARE.description: Prepares the flight controller to receive a firmware update via MSP.

MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_STORE.notes: Requires `MSP_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`. Returns error if storage fails (e.g., out of space, checksum error). Called repeatedly until the entire firmware is transferred. Calls `firmwareUpdateStore()`.
MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_STORE.description: Stores a chunk of firmware data received via MSP.

payload.name: updateType
payload.desc: Type of update (e.g., full flash, specific section - currently ignored/unused).

MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_EXEC.notes: Requires `MSP_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`. Expects 1 byte. Returns error if update cannot start (e.g., not fully received). Calls `firmwareUpdateExec()`. If successful, the device will reboot into the new firmware.
MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_EXEC.description: Executes the firmware update process (flashes the stored firmware and reboots).

MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_ROLLBACK_PREPARE.notes: Requires `MSP_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`. Returns error if rollback preparation fails (e.g., no rollback image available). Calls `firmwareUpdateRollbackPrepare()`.
MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_ROLLBACK_PREPARE.description: Prepares the flight controller to perform a firmware rollback to the previously stored version.

MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_ROLLBACK_EXEC.notes: Requires `MSP_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`. Returns error if rollback cannot start. Calls `firmwareUpdateRollbackExec()`. If successful, the device will reboot into the backup firmware.
MSP2_INAV_FWUPDT_ROLLBACK_EXEC.description: Executes the firmware rollback process (flashes the stored backup firmware and reboots).

payload.name: safehomeIndex
payload.desc: Index of the safe home location (0 to `MAX_SAFE_HOMES - 1`).

payload.name: enabled
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if this safe home is enabled.

MSP2_INAV_SAFEHOME.notes: Requires `USE_SAFE_HOME`. Used by `mspFcSafeHomeOutCommand`. See `MSP2_INAV_SET_SAFEHOME` for setting.
MSP2_INAV_SAFEHOME.description: Get or Set configuration for a specific Safe Home location.

payload.name: safehomeIndex
payload.desc: Index of the safe home location (0 to `MAX_SAFE_HOMES - 1`).

payload.name: enabled
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 to enable this safe home.

MSP2_INAV_SET_SAFEHOME.notes: Requires `USE_SAFE_HOME`. Expects 10 bytes. Returns error if index invalid. Resets corresponding FW autoland approach if `USE_FW_AUTOLAND` is enabled.
MSP2_INAV_SET_SAFEHOME.description: Sets the configuration for a specific Safe Home location.

payload.name: autoThrottleFlag
payload.desc: 1 if navigation is controlling throttle, 0 otherwise (`navigationIsControllingThrottle()`).

MSP2_INAV_MISC2.description: Retrieves miscellaneous runtime information including timers and throttle status.

payload.name: conditionIndex
payload.desc: Index of the condition to retrieve (0 to `MAX_LOGIC_CONDITIONS - 1`).

MSP2_INAV_LOGIC_CONDITIONS_SINGLE.description: Gets the configuration for a single Logic Condition by its index.

MSP2_INAV_ESC_RPM.notes: Requires `USE_ESC_SENSOR`. Payload size depends on the number of detected motors with telemetry.
MSP2_INAV_ESC_RPM.description: Retrieves the RPM reported by each ESC via telemetry.

payload.name: escData
payload.desc: Array of `escSensorData_t` structures containing voltage, current, temp, RPM, errors etc. for each ESC.

MSP2_INAV_ESC_TELEM.notes: Requires `USE_ESC_SENSOR`. See `escSensorData_t` in `sensors/esc_sensor.h` for the exact structure fields.
MSP2_INAV_ESC_TELEM.description: Retrieves the full telemetry data structure reported by each ESC.

payload.name: ledConfig
payload.desc: Full configuration structure for the LED.

MSP2_INAV_LED_STRIP_CONFIG_EX.notes: Requires `USE_LED_STRIP`. See `ledConfig_t` in `io/ledstrip.h` for structure fields (position, function, overlay, color, direction, params).
MSP2_INAV_LED_STRIP_CONFIG_EX.description: Retrieves the full configuration for each LED on the strip using the `ledConfig_t` structure. Supersedes `MSP_LED_STRIP_CONFIG`.

payload.name: ledIndex
payload.desc: Index of the LED to configure (0 to `LED_MAX_STRIP_LENGTH - 1`).

payload.name: ledConfig
payload.desc: Full configuration structure for the LED.

MSP2_INAV_SET_LED_STRIP_CONFIG_EX.notes: Requires `USE_LED_STRIP`. Expects `1 + sizeof(ledConfig_t)` bytes. Returns error if index invalid. Calls `reevaluateLedConfig()`.
MSP2_INAV_SET_LED_STRIP_CONFIG_EX.description: Sets the configuration for a single LED on the strip using the `ledConfig_t` structure. Supersedes `MSP_SET_LED_STRIP_CONFIG`.

payload.name: approachIndex
payload.desc: Index of the approach setting (0 to `MAX_FW_LAND_APPOACH_SETTINGS - 1`).

payload.name: landAlt
payload.desc: Altitude for the final landing phase.

payload.name: approachDirection
payload.desc: Direction of approach (From WP, Specific Heading).

payload.name: landHeading1
payload.desc: Primary landing heading (if approachDirection requires it).

payload.name: landHeading2
payload.desc: Secondary landing heading (if approachDirection requires it).

payload.name: isSeaLevelRef
payload.desc: 1 if altitudes are relative to sea level, 0 if relative to home.

MSP2_INAV_FW_APPROACH.notes: Requires `USE_FW_AUTOLAND`. Used by `mspFwApproachOutCommand`. See `MSP2_INAV_SET_FW_APPROACH` for setting.
MSP2_INAV_FW_APPROACH.description: Get or Set configuration for a specific Fixed Wing Autoland approach.

payload.name: approachIndex
payload.desc: Index of the approach setting (0 to `MAX_FW_LAND_APPOACH_SETTINGS - 1`).

MSP2_INAV_SET_FW_APPROACH.notes: Requires `USE_FW_AUTOLAND`. Expects 15 bytes. Returns error if index invalid.
MSP2_INAV_SET_FW_APPROACH.description: Sets the configuration for a specific Fixed Wing Autoland approach.

payload.name: ubxCommand
payload.desc: Raw U-Blox UBX protocol command frame (including header, class, ID, length, payload, checksum).

MSP2_INAV_GPS_UBLOX_COMMAND.notes: Requires GPS feature enabled (`FEATURE_GPS`) and the GPS driver to be U-Blox (`isGpsUblox()`). Payload must be at least 8 bytes (minimum UBX frame size). Use with extreme caution, incorrect commands can misconfigure the GPS module. Calls `gpsUbloxSendCommand()`.
MSP2_INAV_GPS_UBLOX_COMMAND.description: Sends a raw command directly to a U-Blox GPS module connected to the FC.

MSP2_INAV_RATE_DYNAMICS.description: Retrieves Rate Dynamics configuration parameters for the current control rate profile.

MSP2_INAV_SET_RATE_DYNAMICS.description: Sets Rate Dynamics configuration parameters for the current control rate profile.

payload.name: axisRatio
payload.desc: Roll vs Pitch axis tuning ratio (`ezTune()->axisRatio`).

MSP2_INAV_EZ_TUNE_SET.notes: Requires `USE_EZ_TUNE`. Expects 10 or 11 bytes. Calls `ezTuneUpdate()` after setting parameters.
MSP2_INAV_EZ_TUNE_SET.description: Sets the EZ-Tune parameters and triggers an update.

payload.name: mixerProfileIndex
payload.desc: Index of the mixer profile to activate (0-based).

MSP2_INAV_SELECT_MIXER_PROFILE.notes: Expects 1 byte. Will fail if armed. Calls `setConfigMixerProfileAndWriteEEPROM()`. Only applicable if `MAX_MIXER_PROFILE_COUNT` > 1.
MSP2_INAV_SELECT_MIXER_PROFILE.description: Selects the active mixer profile and saves configuration.

MSP2_ADSB_VEHICLE_LIST.description: Retrieves the list of currently tracked ADSB (Automatic Dependent Surveillance–Broadcast) vehicles.

payload.name: maxTextLength
payload.desc: Maximum length of the text part (`OSD_CUSTOM_ELEMENT_TEXT_SIZE - 1`).

payload.name: maxParts
payload.desc: Maximum number of parts per element (`CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_PARTS`).

MSP2_INAV_CUSTOM_OSD_ELEMENTS.description: Retrieves counts related to custom OSD elements defined by the programming framework.

payload.name: elementIndex
payload.desc: Index of the custom element (0 to `MAX_CUSTOM_ELEMENTS - 1`).

MSP2_INAV_CUSTOM_OSD_ELEMENT.description: Gets the configuration of a single custom OSD element defined by the programming framework.

MSP2_INAV_SET_CUSTOM_OSD_ELEMENTS.notes: Requires `USE_PROGRAMMING_FRAMEWORK`. Expects `1 + (CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_PARTS * 3) + 3 + (OSD_CUSTOM_ELEMENT_TEXT_SIZE - 1)` bytes. Returns error if index or part type is invalid. Null-terminates the text internally.
MSP2_INAV_SET_CUSTOM_OSD_ELEMENTS.description: Sets the configuration of a single custom OSD element defined by the programming framework.

MSP2_INAV_SERVO_CONFIG.description: Retrieves the configuration parameters for all supported servos (min, max, middle, rate). Supersedes `MSP_SERVO_CONFIGURATIONS`.

payload.name: servoIndex
payload.desc: Index of the servo to configure (0 to `MAX_SUPPORTED_SERVOS - 1`).

MSP2_INAV_SET_SERVO_CONFIG.notes: Expects 8 bytes. Returns error if index invalid. Calls `servoComputeScalingFactors()`.
MSP2_INAV_SET_SERVO_CONFIG.description: Sets the configuration parameters for a single servo. Supersedes `MSP_SET_SERVO_CONFIGURATION`.

payload.name: minAltitude
payload.desc: Minimum allowed altitude within the zone (cm).

payload.name: maxAltitude
payload.desc: Maximum allowed altitude within the zone (cm).

payload.name: isSeaLevelRef
payload.desc: Boolean: 1 if altitudes are relative to sea level, 0 if relative to home.

payload.name: fenceAction
payload.desc: Enum (`GEOZONE_ACTION_*`): Action to take upon boundary violation.

payload.name: vertexCount
payload.desc: Number of vertices defined for this zone.

MSP2_INAV_GEOZONE.description: Get configuration for a specific Geozone.

payload.name: vertexCount
payload.desc: Number of vertices to be defined (used for validation later).

MSP2_INAV_SET_GEOZONE.notes: Requires `USE_GEOZONE`. Expects 14 bytes. Returns error if index invalid. Calls `geozoneResetVertices()`. Vertices must be set subsequently using `MSP2_INAV_SET_GEOZONE_VERTEX`.
MSP2_INAV_SET_GEOZONE.description: Sets the main configuration for a specific Geozone (type, shape, altitude, action). **This command resets (clears) all vertices associated with the zone.**

payload.name: vertexId
payload.desc: Index of the vertex within the zone (0-based). For circles, 0 = center.

MSP2_INAV_GEOZONE_VERTEX.notes: Requires `USE_GEOZONE`. Returns error if indexes are invalid or vertex doesn't exist. For circular zones, the radius is stored internally as the 'latitude' of the vertex with index 1.
MSP2_INAV_GEOZONE_VERTEX.description: Get a specific vertex (or center+radius for circular zones) of a Geozone.

MSP2_INAV_SET_GEOZONE_VERTEX.notes: Requires `USE_GEOZONE`. Expects 10 bytes (Polygon) or 14 bytes (Circular). Returns error if indexes invalid or if trying to set vertex beyond `vertexCount` defined in `MSP2_INAV_SET_GEOZONE`. Calls `geozoneSetVertex()`. For circular zones, sets center (vertex 0) and radius (vertex 1's latitude).
MSP2_INAV_SET_GEOZONE_VERTEX.description: Sets a specific vertex (or center+radius for circular zones) for a Geozone.

MSP2_BETAFLIGHT_BIND.notes: Requires `rxConfig()->receiverType == RX_TYPE_SERIAL`. Requires `USE_SERIALRX_CRSF` or `USE_SERIALRX_SRXL2`. Calls `crsfBind()` or `srxl2Bind()` respectively. Returns error if receiver type or provider is not supported for binding.
MSP2_BETAFLIGHT_BIND.description: Initiates the receiver binding procedure for supported serial protocols (CRSF, SRXL2).

payload.name: distanceMm
payload.desc: Measured distance. Negative value indicates out of range.

MSP2_SENSOR_RANGEFINDER.description: Provides rangefinder data (distance, quality) from an external MSP-based sensor.

MSP2_SENSOR_OPTIC_FLOW.description: Provides optical flow data (motion, quality) from an external MSP-based sensor.

payload.name: satellitesInView
payload.desc: Number of satellites used in solution.

MSP2_SENSOR_GPS.description: Provides detailed GPS data from an external MSP-based GPS module.

MSP2_SENSOR_COMPASS.description: Provides magnetometer data from an external MSP-based compass module.

MSP2_SENSOR_BAROMETER.description: Provides barometer data from an external MSP-based barometer module.

MSP2_SENSOR_AIRSPEED.description: Provides airspeed data from an external MSP-based pitot sensor module.

payload.units: Head tracker angles (e.g., int16 Roll, Pitch, Yaw in deci-degrees).

MSP2_SENSOR_HEADTRACKER.notes: Requires `USE_HEADTRACKER` and `USE_HEADTRACKER_MSP`. Calls `mspHeadTrackerReceiverNewData()`. Payload structure needs verification from `mspHeadTrackerReceiverNewData` implementation.
